fair.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a fair situation, system, way of treating people, or judgment seems reasonable, acceptable, and right
fair.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: All we are asking for is a fair wage.
What do you think is the fairest solution?
The report is a fair summary of the issues facing us.
the right to a fair trial
It’s only fair that we tell him what’s happening.
It’s fair to say that by then he had lost the support of his staff.
It seems fair to give them a second chance.
it is fair to do something
I can’t carry on working such long hours. It’s not fair on my family.
fair.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: treating everyone in a way that is right or equal
fair.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Why does Eric get to go and I don’t? It’s not fair!
My boss expects a lot – but he’s very fair.
You pay him $10 an hour – it’s only fair that I should get the same.
The old law wasn’t fair to women.
fair.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: someone who is fair, or who has fair hair or skin, has hair or skin that is very light in colour
fair.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a fair fight, game, or election is one that is played or done according to the rules
fair.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: neither particularly good nor particularly bad
fair.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Her written work is excellent but her practical work is only fair.
fair.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: weather that is fair is pleasant and not windy, rainy etc
fair.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: It should be generally fair and warm for the next few days.
fair.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: treating people equally or in the way that is right
It’s not fair that she gets paid more than me.
Everyone has the right to a fair trial.
just
morally right and fair
a just punishment
a just cause
a just society
Do you think it was a just war?
reasonable
fair and sensible according to most people’s standards
a reasonable request
Lateness, without a reasonable excuse, will not be tolerated.
balanced
giving fair and equal treatment to all sides of an argument or subject
Balanced reporting of the news is essential.
even-handed
giving fair and equal treatment to everyone, especially when it would be easy to favour one particular group
The drama takes an even-handed look at the consequences of violent crime, both on attackers and their victims.
The film is even-handed and does not try to make you support either side.
equitable
giving equal treatment to everyone involved
We need an equitable solution to this problem.
a more equitable distribution of wealth

fair.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: an outdoor event, at which there are large machines to ride on, games to play, and sometimes farm animals being judged and sold
fair.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: an outdoor event with games and things to eat and drink, usually organized to get money for a school, club etc
fair.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a market where animals and farm products are sold
fair.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a situation or arrangement which is fair is reasonable, honest, and acceptable
fair.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The committee takes seriously the need to be fair and just in everything it does.
All we are asking for is a fair wage.
fair.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: a large show where business people producing a particular product or service can meet to advertise or sell their products
fair.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: Many businesses deal less formally, for example at trade fairs.
